sections.content: Enzyme kinetics describes how fast enzymes catalyze reactions. The **Michaelis-Menten equation** shows a hyperbolic relationship between substrate concentration and reaction rate. Logarithmic transformations are used to determine kinetic parameters from experimental data.

sections.explanation: Reaction velocity V depends on substrate concentration [S], maximum velocity Vmax, and the Michaelis constant Km.

sections.definition: The substrate concentration at which reaction velocity equals half of Vmax. Low Km indicates high enzyme-substrate affinity.

points: Lineweaver-Burk plot linearizes the equation using reciprocals
